cluster_configs.description:
A set of key and value pairs that contain the cluster
configuration.

created_at.description:
The date and time when the cluster was created.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_:

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

default_image_id.description: The default ID of the image.

description.description: The description of the cluster.

hadoop_version.description: The version of the Hadoop used in the cluster.

is_default.description: If set to ``true``, the cluster is the default cluster.

is_protected.description: If set to ``true``, the cluster is protected.

is_public.description: If set to ``true``, the cluster is public.

node_groups.description: The detail properties of the node in key-value pairs.

updated_at.description:
The date and time when the cluster was updated.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_:

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

use_autoconfig.description: If set to ``true``, the cluster is auto configured.

cluster_template_id.description: The UUID of the cluster template.

count.description: The number of nodes in the cluster.

info.description: A set of key and value pairs that contain cluster information.

is_transient.description: If set to ``true``, the cluster is transient.

management_public_key.description: The SSH key for the management network.

neutron_management_network.description: The UUID of the neutron management network.

provision_progress.description: A list of the cluster progresses.

status_description.description: The description of the cluster status.

created_at.description:
The date and time when the object was created.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_:

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

description.description: The description of the data source object.

is_protected.description: If set to ``true``, the object is protected.

is_public.description: If set to ``true``, the object is public.

type.description: The type of the data source object.

updated_at.description:
The date and time when the object was updated.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601

::

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

url.description: The url of the data source object.

created_at.description:

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601

::

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

description.description: The description of the job object.

interface.description: The interfaces of the job object.

is_protected.description: If set to ``true``, the object is protected.

is_public.description: If set to ``true``, the object is public.

libs.description: The list of the job object properties.

mains.description: The list of the job object and their properties.

type.description: The type of the job object.

updated_at.description:
The date and time when the object was updated.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_:

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

auto_security_group.description: If set to ``true``, the cluster group is automatically secured.

availability_zone.description: The availability of the node in the cluster.

created_at.description:
The date and time when the node was created in the cluster.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_:

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

description.description: The description of the node in the cluster.

floating_ip_pool.description: The UUID of the pool in the template.

id.description: The UUID of the node in the cluster.

is_default.description: If set to ``true`` the node is the default node in the cluster.

is_protected.description: If set to ``true``, the node is protected.

is_proxy_gateway.description: If set to ``true``, the node is the proxy gateway.

is_public.description: If set to ``true``, the node is public in the cluster.

node_configs.description:
A set of key and value pairs that contain the node configuration in
the cluster.

node_processes.description: The list of the processes performed by the node.

security_groups.description: The security groups of the node.

shares.description: The sharing of resources in the cluster.

updated_at.description:
The date and time when the node was updated.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_:

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

The ``±hh:mm`` value, if included, returns the time zone as an
offset from UTC.

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

use_autoconfig.description: If set to ``true``, the node is auto configured.

volume_local_to_instance.description: If set to ``true``, the volume is local to the instance.

volume_mount_prefix.description: The mount point of the node.

volume_type.description: The type of volume in a node.

volumes_availability_zone.description: The availability zone of the volumes.

volumes_per_node.description: The number of volumes for the node.

volumes_size.description: The size of the volumes in a node.

tags.description: Lists images only with specific tag. Can be used multiple times.

created.description:
The date and time when the image was created.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_:

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

description.description: The description of the image.

image.description: A set of key and value pairs that contain image properties.

images.description: The list of images and their properties.

metadata.description: A set of key and value pairs that contain image metadata.

minDisk.description: The minimum disk space, in GB.

minRam.description:
The minimum amount of random access memory (RAM) for the image, in
GB.

name.description: The name of the operating system image.

progress.description:
A progress indicator, as a percentage value, for the amount of
image content that has been processed.

status.description: The current status of the image.

updated.description:
The date and time when the image was updated.

The date and time stamp format is `ISO 8601
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601>`_:

::

   CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss±hh:mm

For example, ``2015-08-27T09:49:58-05:00``.

job_binary.description: This is a new job binary
job_binary.name: new-jar-example.jar

x-get-job-binaries-show.summary: Shows details for a job binary.

get.description:
The response body shows the job binary raw data and the response
headers show the data length.

Example response:

::

   HTTP/1.1 200 OK
   Connection: keep-alive
   Content-Length: 161
   Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8
   Date: Sat, 28 Mar 2016 02:42:48 GMT
   A = load '$INPUT' using PigStorage(':') as (fruit: chararray);
   B = foreach A generate com.hadoopbook.pig.Trim(fruit);
   store B into '$OUTPUT' USING PigStorage();

parameters.description: The UUID of the job binary.
parameters.name: job_binary_id

Content-Length.description: The length of the data, in bytes.

   B = foreach A generate com.hadoopbook.pig.Trim(fruit);
   store B into '$OUTPUT' USING PigStorage();

put.description:
Job binary internals are objects that represent data processing
applications and libraries that are stored in the internal
database.

Specify the file contents (raw data or script text) in the request
body. Specify the file name in the URI.

plugins.description: The Apache Vanilla plugin provides the ability to launch upstream Vanilla Apache Hadoop cluster without any management consoles. It can also deploy the Oozie component.
plugins.name: vanilla
plugins.title: Vanilla Apache Hadoop

plugins.description: The Hortonworks Sahara plugin automates the deployment of the Hortonworks Data Platform (HDP) on OpenStack.
plugins.name: hdp
plugins.title: Hortonworks Data Platform

plugins.description: The Cloudera Sahara plugin provides the ability to launch the Cloudera distribution of Apache Hadoop (CDH) with Cloudera Manager management console.
plugins.name: cdh
plugins.title: Cloudera Plugin

tags.name: plugins
tags.x-summary:
A plugin object defines the Hadoop or Spark version that it can
install and which configurations can be set for the cluster.

tags.name: imageregistry
tags.x-summary:
Use the image registry tool to manage images, add tags to and
remove tags from images, and define the user name for an instance
operating system. Each plugin lists required tags for an image. To
run remote operations, the Data Processing service requires a user
name with which to log in to the operating system for an instance.

tags.name: node-group-template
tags.x-summary:
A cluster is a group of nodes with the same configuration. A node
group template configures a node in the cluster.

A template configures Hadoop processes and VM characteristics, such
as the number of reduced slots for task tracker, the number of
CPUs, and the amount of RAM. The template specifies the VM
characteristics through an OpenStack flavor.

tags.name: clustertemplate
tags.x-summary:
A cluster template configures a Hadoop cluster. A cluster template
lists node groups with the number of instances in each group. You
can also define cluster-scoped configurations in a cluster
template.

tags.name: clusters
tags.x-summary: A cluster is a group of nodes with the same configuration.

tags.name: event-log
tags.x-summary:
The event log feature provides information about cluster
provisioning. In the event of errors, the event log shows the
reason for the failure.

tags.name: datasources
tags.x-summary:
A data source object defines the location of input or output for
MapReduce jobs and might reference different types of storage.

The Data Processing service does not validate data source
locations.

tags.name: jobbinary-internals
tags.x-summary:
Job binary internal objects represent data processing applications
and libraries that are stored in the internal database.

tags.name: jobbinaries
tags.x-summary:
Job binary objects represent data processing applications and
libraries that are stored in either the internal database or the
Object Storage service.

tags.name: jobs
tags.x-summary:
A job object lists the binaries that a job needs to run. To run a
job, you must specify data sources and job parameters.

You can run a job on an existing or new transient cluster.

tags.name: job-executions
tags.x-summary:
A job execution object represents a Hadoop job that runs on a
cluster. A job execution polls the status of a running job and
reports it to the user. Also a user can cancel a running job.

tags.name: job-types
tags.x-summary:
Each plugin that supports EDP also supports specific job types.
Different versions of a plugin might actually support different job
types. Configuration options vary by plugin, version, and job type.

The job types provide information about which plugins support which
job types and how to configure the job types.
